Description: The Graphic Arts and Crafts Yearbook, Vol. IV
Azo pigments developed for yellow ink
New York Times is the first newspaper to use gravure.
Tungstated and molybdates pigments discovered for magenta Ink
Hallmark creates its first Christmas card
U.S. enters World War I
Bauhaus School founded in Weimar, Germany
19th Amendment, giving women the right to vote
Penrose's Annual 1920 - The Process Yearbook, Victory Volume No. 22
1921- Wirephoto transmitted by telephotography.
Koenig & Bauer launch the four-color Iris printing press in 1923
Lithographic Technical Foundation founded, which became GATF in 1964
Amelia Earhart flies across the Atlantic Ocean
Phthalocyanine pigments discovered for cyan ink
Gill Sans typeface is created
The Great Depression starts
Times New Roman typeface debuted by the The Times newspaper in London
Dust Bowl begins
National Association of Photolithographers (NAPL) founded
Alex Murray published first comprehensive information on photogenic masking
The first commercially successful series of paperback books is published by Penguin Books in the UK in 1935
Klimsch Jahrbuch, Vol. 29
Life Magazine started publication using letterpress
Nazi Germany invades Poland; World War II begins
The Penrose Annual, Vol. 40
In 1938 Xerography, a dry photocopying technique, is invented by Chester Carlson.
Germany surrenders, end of World War II in Europe
Japanese machine tool manufacturer Shinohara Machinery Company begins manufacturing flatbed letterpress machines in 1948
TAGA is founded by Frank Preucil, Mike Bruno, and others
Phototypesetting developed
Korean War begins
The Penrose Annual, Vol. 44
Inkjet printing is developed
First DRUPA is held at Dusseldorf, Germany
The Wonderful World of Insects becomes the first book composed by phototypesetting
The Tournament of Roses Parade becomes the first event nationally televised in color
Rosa Parks and the Montgomery bus boycott
Helvetica is introduced
Dye Sublimation is invented
Vietnam War begins
Graphic Arts Japan, Vol. 3
IBM "golf ball" typewriter introduced
Cuban Missile Crisis
Pantone Color Matching System introduced
Civil Rights Act of 1964
Polygraph Jahrbuch, Vol. 4
"Summer of Love."
ISBN (International Standard Book Number) started
Dot matrix printing introduced
Neil Armstrong walks on the Moon
Water-based ink is introduced
